content: Hey! Welcome to ProfitAgent. Let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks! I'm exploring the dashboard now.
Great. Check the reporting tab for detailed metrics.
I see it. How often does the data refresh?
Data refreshes every hour. Realtime streaming is coming soon.
Awesome, thanks for the quick reply!
Anytime! Let me know if you need onboarding material.
Sure. Also is there a dark mode?
Yep! Toggle it in the sidebar soon (feature flag).
Hello! I'm seeing a delay in the reporting numbers.
Hi there — delays can happen if backfill is running. When did you first notice it?
About an hour ago. It seems stuck at yesterday's totals.
Got it. I'm triggering a manual refresh — should update in ~5 mins.
Refreshed! Thanks — looks good now.
Hey team, is there a sandbox dataset I can play with?
Yes! Enable 'Demo Data' in settings > workspace. It won't affect prod.
Perfect. Also can I invite a teammate on the free plan?
Free plan supports up to 2 seats. Additional seats need Pro.
Got it, thanks! I'll upgrade if we expand.

Here's a really long outgoing message to test how the bubble wraps and expands within the container. It contains multiple sentences so we can observe line breaks, spacing, and overall readability across different viewport widths. The goal is to ensure the max-width constraint works and text doesn't overflow or cause layout shifts. This should approximate a user pasting a large block of explanatory text into the chat.

Continuing the long-form explanation: if you notice any strange wrapping behavior (like excessive whitespace or broken clustering), we may need to tweak flex settings or add hyphenation. This second long outgoing message appears immediately after the previous one to form an outgoing cluster.
Thanks for the detailed context — I'm reading through it now.
Quick follow-up: will the system handle extremely long unbroken strings_like_this_one_that_has_no_spaces_and_should_force_wrapping_or_scrolling?

Also, could you confirm whether multiline messages with intentional line breaks are preserved? For example:

Line A
Line B
Line C

If these render correctly, the whitespace-pre-line style is working as intended.
